question: Will SpaceX's Starship successfully reach outer space by December 31, 2021?
description: This is a market on whether SpaceX will successfully complete a launch of the next Starship intended to reach outer space, currently dubbed "SN20", by December 31st, 2021. A successful launch will mean that Starship takes off from its launchpad in Boca Chica, TX, and successfully reaches an altitude of 62 miles above sea level. The outcome will be corroborated by examining SpaceX’s official video feed of the launch (https://www.youtube.com/c/SpaceX), as well as secondary video feeds or written reports if necessary. If the Starship completes a successful launch by December 31st, 2021, 11:59PM ET, this market will resolve to “Yes”. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”. Any subsequent anomaly (e.g. an explosion) after the vehicle reaches 62 miles will have no bearing on the outcome. Any name change of the Starship or replacement of "SN20" with another vehicle (i.e. "SN21", etc.) will have no bearing on the outcome of the market. Any SpaceX Starship launch that is not intended for outer space will have no bearing on the market. This market will resolve solely on whether the first Starship launch intended to reach outer space will successfully reach 62 miles above sea level. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, this market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will August 2021 average global temperature be the highest August temperature on record?
description:
This is a market on whether the average global land and ocean surface temperature for August 2021 will be the highest August temperature since global records began in 1880.
The resolution source for this market will be the Global Climate Report for August 2021, published by NOAA's National Centers for Environmental Information (https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/sotc/global/2021). 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if, for the month of August 2021 averaged as a whole, global land and ocean surface temperature anomaly, as measured by U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, will be greater than 0.98°C (1.76°F) above the 20th century average of 15.6°C (60.1°F), and “No” otherwise. Past data for the month of August can be found here https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/cag/global/time-series/globe/land_ocean/1/8/1880-2021. This market will resolve when data is first available for the month of August 2021. In the event of an ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will any of the Secretary of State, Secretary of Defense, or Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff no longer hold their position on October 1, 2021?
description: This is a market on whether one or more of Lloyd Austin, Antony Blinken, and Mark A. Milley will no longer hold their current positions of Secretary of Defense, Secretary of State, and Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. This market will resolve to “Yes” if any of the three positions (Secretary of Defense, Secretary of State, and Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff) are vacant or occupied by someone other than its occupant at the commencement of this market. This market will also resolve to “Yes” if one or more of the positions is held by an individual in an “Acting” capacity other than its occupant at the commencement of this market. This market will also resolve to “Yes” if, before the resolution of this market at 12:01 P.M. ET on October 1, 2021, one or more of Lloyd Austin, Antony Blinken, and Mark A. Milley announce a resignation to take effect after 12:01 P.M. ET on October 1, 2021. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No." The resolution source will be any credible news and government sources such as https://www.whitehouse.gov/administration/cabinet/. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will Medina Spirit be disqualified from the 2021 Kentucky Derby by October 15?
description: This is a market on whether Medina Spirit, who failed a post-race drug test, will be disqualified from the 147th Kentucky Derby, before October 15, 2021, 12:00 PM ET, the resolution date. This market will resolve to “Yes” if Medina Spirit is disqualified from the 2021 Kentucky Derby, as verified in the upload of an official ruling by the Kentucky Horse Racing Commission Stewards against trainer Robert Baffert to their website at https://khrc.ky.gov/new_bulletin.aspx?bullid=2 on or before the resolution date. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Who will win the 2021 World Chess Championship?
description: This is a market on who will win the upcoming World Chess Championship 2021 to be held in Dubai, United Arab Emirates between November 24th 2021 and December 16th 2021. The defending Champion Magnus Carlsen is playing the Challenger Ian Nepomniachtchi. The match is 14 games and the first player to 7.5 points will be the Winner in this market. If after 14 games, the match is equal at 7.0 points to each player, then the winner of the tiebreaks will be the Winner in this market. If the event is canceled both positions will pay out $0.50. If either player withdraws for any reason, the replacement will take the place of the player they are replacing in the market. For example: If Ian Nepomniachtchi withdraws and his replacement goes on to win the tournament, then this market will resolve $1.00 to Ian Nepomniachtchi. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will OpenTable’s “Seated diners from online, phone, and walk-in reservations” data point for the United States exceed its 2019 baseline by 7% or more by November 1, 2021?
description:
In response to trader inquiry: This market will resolve according to the resolution source’s website data table, where final daily percentages rounded to the nearest whole number are recorded, and not the live graph. If the website data table is unavailable, rounded numbers from the downloadable csv will be used. Each daily check will check numbers from the day of the market’s inception, August 19, up to the day prior.

This is a market on whether OpenTable’s State of the Industry site will display a day whose  “Seated diners from online, phone, and walk-in reservations” exceed its 2019 baseline by 7% or more on or before November 1, 2021. This market will resolve to “Yes” if, on or before November 1, 2021, 3 PM ET, https://www.opentable.com/state-of-industry lists an increase of 7% or more for the United States under the section “Seated diners from online, phone, and walk-in reservations.” This market will resolve to “No” if there is not a single day between the beginning of the market and November 1, 2021, inclusive, with an increase of at least 7% compared to its 2019 baseline. The resolution source will be checked daily at 3 P.M. ET each day following the opening of this market and will resolve if an increase of 7% or more is displayed for the United States. The resolution source will be checked for the last time at 3 P.M. ET on November 2, 2021, or once per day until November 9, 2021 if data for November 1 is not immediately available. If no data is available for November 1, 2021 at 3 P.M. ET on November 9, 2021 and no day before November 1 has an increase of 7% or more, this market will resolve to “No.” In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will Miso Robotics expand its restaurant partnerships in 2021?
description: This is a market on whether Miso Robotics, the maker of “Flippy” the fast food robot, will partner with a restaurant other than White Castle or CaliBurger after the market creation date, August 19, 2021, and before the market expiration date, January 1, 2022, 12:00 AM ET. A partnership is defined as any agreement for a current or future product implementation. Note, partnerships with stadiums or any companies that hold real estate for food services are valid. This market will resolve if Techcrunch, Wired, or Engadget report the partnership before the market expiration date, or if there is a definitive statement from Miso Robotics or a partner company. This market will resolve to “Yes” if Miso Robotics expands its restaurant partnerships within the market’s time-frame. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.” In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will Armin Laschet be the next chancellor of Germany?
description: This is a market on whether Armin Laschet, leader of the CDU party, will win an upcoming German chancellor’s election. This market will resolve to “Yes” if Armin Laschet is the next elected chancellor, and “No” otherwise. The 2021 German federal election is expected to be held on September 26, 2021, after which either a chancellor may be elected and appointed, or a new federal election will be held and the process will repeat. This market will resolve only when there is a successful chancellor’s election, meaning once a chancellor has been both elected by the Bundestag and appointed by the president. For instance, if the first round of elections is inconclusive and Merkel remains chancellor in the meantime, and the second round is won by Laschet, this market will resolve as "Yes." This market will resolve according to the German government’s website (https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-en/chancellor) and the United Nations' Protocol and Liaison Service (protocol.un.org/dgacm/pls/site.nsf/HSHGNFA.xsp). In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, this market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will there be over 220,000 encounters at the US-Mexico border in August 2021?
description: This is a market on if southwest land border encounters will exceed 220,000 in August of 2021. This market will be resolved according to the statistics reported at https://www.cbp.gov/newsroom/stats/southwest-land-border-encounters. This market will resolve to “Yes” if southwest border encounters exceed 220,000 in August, and “No” otherwise. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will Messi score a goal on his PSG debut?
description: This is a market on whether Lionel Messi will score a goal in his debut game for Paris Saint-Germain. Messi’s debut game is defined as his first game where he plays for at least five minutes. This market will resolve to “Yes” if Messi scores in his debut game for PSG, and “No” otherwise. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, this market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will weekly jobless claims exceed 348K for the week ending on August 21?
description: This is a market on whether the number of Americans that file weekly jobless claims will exceed 348,000 for the week ending on Saturday, August 21, 2021. This market will resolve to “Yes” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were more than 348,000 seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on August 21, 2021. This market will resolve to “No” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were 348,000 or less seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on August 21, 2021.  The resolution source for this market will be the United States Department of Labor’s Weekly Uninsurance Claims report for the week ending on Saturday, August 21, 2021, expected to be released on Thursday, August 26, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data. If data is not available for the aforementioned dates by Wednesday, September 1, 2021, 12:00 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

This market will resolve to “No” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were 348,000 or less seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on August 21, 2021.  The resolution source for this market will be the United States Department of Labor’s Weekly Uninsurance Claims report for the week ending on Saturday, August 21, 2021, expected to be released on Thursday, August 26, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. question: What will be the average price for a NYC unrestricted taxi medallion in August 2021?
description: This is a scalar market on what the average price of a NYC unrestricted taxi medallion will be in August 2021. The lower bound for this market is $60,000.00 USD and the upper bound is $120,000.00 USD. The resolution source for this market will be the August 2021 spreadsheet documenting medallion transfers provided by the NYC Taxi & Limousine Commission (https://www1.nyc.gov/site/tlc/businesses/medallion-transfers.page). The market is only for unrestricted taxi medallions. Rows in the spreadsheet showing a price of $0.00 will not be included in the average computation. Rows not including a number of medallions in the transfer will not included in the average computation. This market will resolve when the data is posted by the NYC Taxi and Limousine Commission at the resolution source. If the resolution data is not available by September 30, 2021, the resolution price will be set to the average unrestricted NYC medallion price for months January - July 2021. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will PAW Patrol: The Movie and The Protege have a combined domestic opening weekend gross of over 17M?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if the combined domestic opening weekend gross of PAW Patrol: The Movie and The Protege is over $17,000,000, and “No” otherwise. The resolution sources are https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl1757315585/ for PAW Patrol: The movie, and https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl1555988993/ for The Protege. The opening weekend numbers for both movies will be added up to determine the resolution of this market. 

To resolve the market, the sources will be checked on August 23, 2021, 3 PM ET. If the box office sales data is based on a studio estimate rather than actual data, or if there is no data available, the sources will be checked every 24 hours until the actual data is available. If the actual data is not available on the resolution source by August 30, 2021, 3 PM ET, then another credible source will chosen by the MIC and checked. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved in good faith at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).

question: Will TSM or Immortals win their LCS Playoffs matchup on August 20, 2021?
description: This is a market on whether TSM or Immortals will win their best of five series in the League of Legends Championship Series Playoffs on August 20, 2021, 6:00 PM ET. This market will resolve to “TSM” if TSM wins the series. If Immortals wins, it will resolve to “Immortals.” If this series is, for any reason, postponed, the same market resolution conditions will apply for whenever the series is rescheduled. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).
